main event: An unidentified bright white object was observed by military personnel at Langley AFB in Virginia for over an hour on March 8, 1966.
interesting points: The object was reported to be round in shape and compared in size to a pea held at arm's length.
The object remained stationary at an angle of 110 degrees from the Coast Guard Chesapeake Light Ship and 60 degrees above the horizon.
The object was observed continuously for over an hour, from 0940 Zulu to 1109 Zulu, and was visible the entire time.
Binoculars were used by one of the observers, Captain Cauley, to view the object.
The weather conditions at the time included some cloudiness, but a bright full moon was visible, as well as other stars.
witnesses: Captain Cauley (USAF), E-5 Shoe (USCG), and E-3 Stompmaker (USCG)
photographs: no photographs included in the report
